result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcal Bonds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court ordered restitution payable in the stipulated amounts of $500.00 to Judy H. and $119.00 to Dewain R. to be paid by the end of supervision period.  Any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.

Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments, and costs by the end of supervision period- any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment. Provided DNA sample- pay surcharge. Pay supervision fees. Provide a DNA sample - pay surcharge.
With credit of 496 DAYS time served. With Dodge to be the reception center.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain employment- hours as deemed appropriated by department of corrections.
Obtain high school diploma or GED or HSED.
Obtain bachelors degree.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
No Contact with any other non-blood family members under the age of 25 years if your brother is present.

superTimeConds.notes: Complete 150 hours of community service- organizations/locations to be determined by Bishop Sedwick D. or Detective Draeger.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (55 pages) commencing 08-31-2015 SENTENCING HEARING - MORNING received and filed.
Crime Victim Impact Statements (x2), received and filed.

Attorney Allison Marie Ritter appeared TELEPHONICALLY on behalf of the defendant.  Defendant NOT in court; in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The case the defendant is to testify on was adjourned to a date in August 2015.
Parties request an adjournment in late August 2015.
Case adjourned to 08-31-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Sentencing Hearing.

  ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.

Atty. Allison Ritter and ADA Joy Hammond contacted the clerk today VIA EMAIL to reschedule the 02-11-2015 at 1:30 PM Sentencing Hearing.  Case adjourned to 06-18-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Sentencing Hearing.

Atty. Allison Ritter and ADA Joy Hammond contacted the clerk today VIA EMAIL to reschedule the 02-11-2015 at 1:30 PM Sentencing Hearing.  Case adjourned to 04-13-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Sentencing Hearing.

Atty. Allison Ritter and ADA Joy Hammond contacted the clerk today VIA EMAIL to reschedule the 01-21-2015 at 8:30 AM Sentencing Hearing.  Case adjourned to 02-11-2015 at 1:30 PM for Adjourned Sentencing Hearing.

Atty. Allison Ritter appeared TELEPHONICALLY on behalf of the defendant.  Defendant, Marcal Bonds, NOT in court - in custody.  ADA Joy Hammond appeared on behalf of the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Ritter is unavailable today.
Parties request an adjournment of the Sentencing Hearing.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 01-22-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Sentencing Hearing.
for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI); signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to the Probation Department for processing.

Defendant Marcal Bonds in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Defendant Marcal Bonds in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #s 2, 3, 4, and 5 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

Court, on its own motion, ordered a PSI "without" a sentencing recommendation.

Court finds good cause to adjourn the sentencing phase.
Case adjourned to 12-01-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

(DEFENDANT REMANDED WITHOUT BAIL INTO CUSTODY WITH THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT IN COURT)

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Attorney Allison M Ritter in court, defendant Marcal Bonds not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a projected Plea Hearing date.
Case adjourned to 09-16-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Projected Plea Hearing.

Defendant Marcal Bonds NOT in court, in custody.  Attorney for defendant, Allison Ritter, NOT in court.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Ritter is unable to appear today.
Atty. Ritter had to leave town for a family emergency.
Clerk rescheduled this matter with ADA Hammond and Atty. Ritter's secretary.
Case adjourned to 07-07-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Scheduling Conference.

Defendant Marcal Bonds in court with attorney Allison M Ritter.  Defendant Marcal Bonds in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Dontae W.; Deion C.; Jarquise R.; Dewain R or Judy H

Defendant Marcal Bonds in court with attorney Matthew A Lamke.  Defendant Marcal Bonds in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
